DOC.brief_summary: Background：Patellofemoral pain syndrome（PFPS） common knee disorder characterize anterior retropatellar pain associated activity load patellofemoral joint . Previous study reveal vastus medialis obliquus（VMO） important dynamic medial stabilizer patellar . Insufficiency VMO lead lateral shift patella increase patellofemoral contact force . An vitro study conduct Hubbard JK . et al . claim significant relationship several morphologic characteristic VMO extent patellofemoral joint deterioration . We consider condition might different vivo , choose ultrasonogrphy measurement tool examine morphology VMO PFPS patient healthy control . Purpose：To determine significant difference several morphologic parameter VMO patient PFPS healthy control 50 . Method：31 PFPS patient 31 match healthy adult 50 recruit study . The HDI 5000 ultrasonography machine use evaluate morphologic parameter VMO , include percent patella attachment , fiber angle , volume attach patella , change shape VMO .
DOC.brief_title: Morphology VMO Patients With PFPS Healthy Young Adults -- A Sonographic Study
DOC.criteria: 1. 50 year old . 2 . Have diagnosis PFPS . 1 . Diagnosis PFPS，such meniscal lesion , ligamentous instability , patellar tendon pathology , traction apophysitis , radiation pain , refer pain , ect . 2 . Knee operation within three month . 3 . Xray finding ( 1 ) joint space narrowing ( 2 ) osteophyte formation
